alert.note: Alert for Bordeaux, Chugwater, Wheatland; Central and West Carbon; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Foothills and High Plains; Middle North Platte River Basin, Niobrara and Converse High Plains; Niobrara, Lower Elevations of Converse, Thunder Basin National Grassland; North Laramie Range and Adjacent High Plains; North Laramie Valley, Shirley Basin; North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range, Medicine Bow NF; Snowy Range, Medicine Bow NF; Southern Laramie Range; Southern Laramie Valley; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 19 at 3:30PM MDT until September 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED TODAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHEAST WYOMING AND THE NORTHERN NEBRASKA PANHANDLE... * WIND...West to southwest 15 to 25 MPH with gusts up to 40 MPH. * HUMIDITY...8 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
